description:
Usually not a fan of the ""BBQ""  burger style but THE DUKE was the best burger I had in awhile.  The fries that came with were very good as well.  Garlic, hot, and crispy on the outside.
The Duke Burger (Angus Beef, Smoked Applewood Bacon, Spring Mix. Onion Rings, BBQ Sauce, Cheese Bread).
Tip:  Find them on the BAREBOTTLE BREWING CO. scheduled food truck calendar ( I caught them on a Sunday) for a place to sit and a great beer tap room for a cold one.  Bring your burger inside, that's what the trucks are there for.
Service was phenomenal. If it's your first time, look for Eileen.  Cute red head with lots a knowledge, glowing personality and eager to show you the ropes.   Sampling before you buy is encouraged, as Eileen explains it, they are the Baskin Robbins of Beer.
author: John W.

description:
Me So Hungry offers primarily sliders and burgers, often in unusual flavor combinations like PB&J. I've tried the both the KTM and the Flyin' Hawaiian sliders before. The KTM sliders were deliciously goopy and tasty, featuring marinated short ribs, pepper jack cheese, crispy onions, and spicy spicy crème fraiche. The Flyin' Hawaiian sliders were also yummy, featuring chicken, crispy onions, and chipotle aioli. 

Prices have gotten just a tad spendy over the last few years, given that these are slider-sized portions, while the menu hasn't changed much, but there's no denying that you will get a tasty treat. Still a decent option to have at a food truck festival, especially if you get some items from different trucks to share with a group.
author: Vincent L.

description: Just hired them for a graduation party last night. Food was amazing just like the reviews suggest, especially the fries! The owner, however, was one of the rudest owners of a business I have ever come across. Very arrogant when approached for anything. The turning point was when I asked for empty paper boats for people who want just fries and was practically thrown one dirty one!!
author: Joan P.

description:
Oh sure, I've seen their familiar pink-and-black truck around town (photo: http://bit.ly/1DSRE0u), the last time likely being the Eat Real Food Festival over in Oakland. As you can probably guess, I'm not much of a food truck connoisseur, but even I've heard good things about Me So Hungry from people who follow the Off the Grid markets. I don't mind them, I just don't seek them out, but this one landed on my doorstep, or at least in front of the office building where I work. Since I was tired of getting my daily vegetarian sandwich that particular day, I decided to go for broke and ordered the relatively bargain priced Cali Sliders at $8. You get two with an order, nice little Angus beef patties stacked with smoked Applewood bacon, balsamic sauteed onions, mixed greens and Gorgonzola cheese, encased in a freshly baked bun.

I also went for a $4 order of the Garlic Parmesan Fries with little regard for my colleagues back at the office who had to sit next to me at a staff meeting (photo: http://bit.ly/1NeZZRi). There were plenty of other sliders to consider (though they appear to run out quickly judging from the number of crossed lines on the menu) and regular-size temptations like the $9 Monster Burger that featured cheddar and Asian BBQ sauce, the $10 Duke that included onion rings and cheese bread, and the obligatory Garden Burger for $9. But for $12, I got a pretty decent amount of food that was well prepared for a truck. The sliders were devoured pretty quickly, but that was just as well since I was eating at my desk and didn't feel like being interrogated over how good they were. Yes, they're good, now go back to your computer please!

FOOD - 4 stars...better sliders and fries than you would think you would get from a food truck
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...uhhh, it's a truck...what ambiance?
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...the food is prepared pretty quickly considering the growing queue
TOTAL - 4 stars...burgers from a truck? I can dig it
author: Ed U.

description:
Me So Hungry? Um yeah I'm still so hungry, considering they're usually out of half their menu offerings. 

They specialize in sliders and they don't come cheaply. $16 got me a couple KTM sliders which were missing the advertised pepper jack cheese (seriously?) and a pile of underachieving parmesan garlic fries.

And whether I arrive at 6pm or 10pm, they're always out of the banana creme buns... time to remove them from the menu permanently, perhaps? The sliders are certainly tasty, but the sloppy assembly and cavalier staff attitude add up to a no bueno for me. 

Skip it.
author: Jelena Z.

description:
I like MeSoHungry's sliders.  I've visited a few trucks that specialize in Sliders and they usually aren't very good.  But theirs are actually done pretty well, very reasonable portion sizes, and taste pretty good.

They have 3 kinds of sliders:

Cali Sliders --  http://bit.ly/U2AbsB
Angus beef, Smoked Apple-Wood Bacon, Balsamic Sauteed Onions, Gorgonzola Cheese Sauce

KTM Sliders -- http://bit.ly/Ui1boq
Marinated Short Ribs, PepperJack Cheese, Crispy Onions, Spicy Creme Fraiche

Flyin' Hawaiian Sliders w/ Garlic Parmesean Shoe String Fries  --  http://bit.ly/TYaAXQ
Chicken, Crispy Maui Onions, Chipotle Aioli

My favorite out the the three is definitely the KTM Sliders with their marinated short ribs.  They're so packed with flavor.  The Cali burgers are okay and the Chicken Hawaiian sliders also have a nice tangy flavor to them.

It's pretty cool that their sliders and burgers are fresh and made to order, but sometimes the wait can be pretty long.  After a few visits, it seems to take about 15 minutes to get your food on average.  Luckily I'm a patient customer so it doesn't bother me too much, especially when they're really busy outside of a bar or other food truck gathering sites.

Overall, despite the long wait times,  I think MeSoHungry is a good truck, but it probably wouldn't be my first choice if I had to choose from several trucks at Off The Grid or SOMA Streat Food Park.  I'll still pay them a visit if I have a good craving for their KTM Sliders.
author: Rodney H.

description:
Me So Hungry showed up as a caterer for a first birthday party at a park. I thought that was really cool. There were four people in front of us and to get up to order took about 20 mins. We ordered again and the wait to get our food was another 20 mins. Forty minutes total and my stomache was ready to eat itself.

What we swallowed:

SLIDER SAMPLER:
CALI SLIDER (ANGUS BEEF WITH SMOKED APPLE WOOD BACON, BALSAMIC SAUTEED ONIONS MINUS THE GORGONZOLA CHEESE): This was a pretty good burger. The meets was cooked well done (as requested) and this was tasty.

KTM SLIDER (SHORT RIBS WITH PEPPER JACK CHEESE, CRISPY ONIONS MINUS THE CREME FRAICHE): Other than the fact that I had a huge chunk of short rib (It was seriously the size of half my fist) in between this little tiny slider bun, the meat had a good flavor although the crispy onions were very limp.

FLYIN HAWAIIAN SLIDER (SHREDDED CHICKEN WITH CRISPY MAUI ONIONS AND CHIPOTLE AIOLI): The chicken was very sweet but what's worse was it was COLD! Ugh! Cold shredded chicken! Yuck! One bite and I was done with it!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/me-so-hungry-san-francisco?select=wRhtEfnYkJ68L9URt9nuIg#yC94fYHeToHTTT7Khtvyhw

MONSTER BURGER (ANGUS, BACON, CHEDDAR CHEESE, LETTUCE AND ASIAN BBQ SAUCE): This burger was a MONSTER indeed! HUGE! It looked promising but we ordered ours well done (hello? I'm pregnant!) and we pretty much got it rare. Soooo pink in the middle it was almost gross, even if you liked it medium rare, it was wayy pink! There was no way I could eat it.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/me-so-hungry-san-francisco?select=wRhtEfnYkJ68L9URt9nuIg#JwZ9f4fKqeNBiAhq09B0Sw
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/me-so-hungry-san-francisco?select=wRhtEfnYkJ68L9URt9nuIg#wRhtEfnYkJ68L9URt9nuIg

SHOE STRING FRENCH FRIES: Really? Shoe string? Look how thick those fries are! Mind you, they are up against a MONSTER BURGER but those are steak fries people!

SWEET POTATO FRIES seasoned with Garlic and Parmesan & Parsley: You can't really mess up sweet potato fries and I'm so glad they didn't. It was the best thing that came off that truck. Good flavors and wasn't sopping in grease. THESE fries were cut thin. How'd they go from shoe string sweet potato to shoe-string/steak fries? These were the best thing that came off that truck.

I'm glad I got to experience their truck but I wasn't impressed if the best thing that came off it was the Sweet Potato fries following by the KTM Slider. It's a little discerning when you ask for a well-done burger and get something not even remotely close (I said 'Well-done" please, not "Mooing"). I don't think I would hit them up again but if someone around me ordered from their truck, I would take a bite to see if they can redeem themselves but this one is a definite pass.
author: Vivian A.

description: Ordered onion rings, they were burnt. I could literally taste charcoal. When I returned and presented my food, I was greeted with the most rude customer service. The guy told me that's how they made them! OK, these were dark and burnt, they replaced them, they were slightly better. When I picked up my order, the guy was still rude when he handed me my food and told me that was as good as it was gonna get! I'm sure the rest of the food was good, but I would never go back. This guy was horrible!
author: d p.

description: Man, I was so excited to try this truck. I love the idea of it, but I rarely eat red meat and was waiting for a day when I was craving it. Today was the day! I got the Cali sliders and sweet potato fries. For one thing, $17 for lunch is ridonk. Never again. But worse, the burgers were so salty they were barely edible. Three hours later and I'm still downing water like I've been walking in a desert for a day. Next time I'll stick with my usual food truck. Sigh.
author: Amy B.

description:
Took the sampler slider and glad I did.  The slider orders come in 2a but the sampler was in 3s. If I had to rank them, I'd go with the Hawaiian chicken then the shirt rub and then the cali slider.  

I preferred the first two and wont be going for the Cali.  It was just like a cheeseburger for me.  Good but nothing special for me.

Food was quick.  Get the sweet potato fries or the onion rings
author: Erik H.

description:
I had Me So Hungry again today as they were parked outside of Bluxome Street Winery during their weekly friday event. This is now the third time I've given in to the flashy pink and black monster that is Me So Hungry. I almost always regret the gutbomb that ensues, but it is delicious all the same, provided you know which dishes are good, and which to pass on. 

The buns on all of their options are very good. Tasty and perfectly charred on the inside, this is one of the best parts about their food.

The burgers, in my opinion, are not worth getting. While filling, not much stands out to me about them. The same goes for the cali slider, which uses the same patties.

The hawaiian sliders are very poor as well. The only good part about these are the chipotle aioli and the buns.

My favorite dish here is the KTM slider. The marinated short ribs are very tasty and soft. Together with the pepperjack cheese, crispy onion strings and creme fraiche sauce, this just melts in your mouth. I order this every time now.

Their parmesan sweet potato fries are a nice side dish to go with the KTM sliders. It also uses the creme fraiche sauce as well as parmesan and parsley. Since it is sweet potato instead of regular fries it is slightly more health as well, although not much.

Overall this is one of the better trucks out there, although it is somewhat pricey.
author: Mark O.

description:
If you happen to run across Me So Hungry while in SF, DO NOT KEEP WALKING. Stop, drop and order something off the menu real quick!!

I loooove food trucks, and this one does not disappoint. While most of their menu is meat-centric, I was happy that they offered a couple options for us non-meat lovers. 

I ordered the veggie burger that came with sweet potato fries topped with garlic and parmesan. OMG. So so so so good. Before I had a chance to sit down and eat, literally ten people asked me what I ordered and said they couldn't wait to try Me So Hungry. Talk about letting your food do the advertising for you. Veggie burger: Phenom! Don't think I set it down once. Fries: amazzzzzing! Lasted all day as a snack and fed my hungry coworkers and I. 12 hours later and I am still full. 

To boot, the owner and his staff were really sweet and super friendly. Definitely check this place out if you get the chance!
author: Christine E.

description:
What I ate: Slider sampler, sweet potato fries, regular fries
Visit date: October 3, 2013
First time? Yes.

Me So Hungry was hanging out at Novela so I checked them out. Unfortunately, they were a little disorganized, not to mention late to open, but the staff is friendly and once we ordered I felt well taken care of. They even brought the food into Novela for us instead of making us wait at the truck. Nice!

The slider sampler had three sliders: the Cali, KTM, and flyin' Hawaiian. The Cali had Angus beed and smoked apple-wood bacon. The meat was a bit chewy, but I enjoyed the sauteed onions, and surprisingly, even the gorgonzola cheese sauce. The KTM had pulled pork; it was juicy, tender, and oh-so flavorful. The flyin' Hawaiian had chicken, Maui onions, and chipotle aioli. The flavors were great, but the chicken was tough and dry. I preferred the regular fries over the sweet potato fries which were soggy.
author: Erin G.

description:
I ordered the Slider Sampler which came with one Cali Slider, KTM, and Flyin' Hawaiian. 

The KTM was filled with a good amount of tender short ribs, but they weren't that flavorful. I think they were trying to go for a sweet Korean type of marinade, but it was pretty bland.

The Flyin' Hawaiian was somewhat better. The shredded chicken was a little bit dry, but it had a little more flavor than the short ribs. It was suppose to come with Chipotle Aioli, but I couldn't taste the smoky chipotle flavor. There was some kick to it, but it tasted like Korean chili paste. It still could've been bolder with the seasoning and spices. They should just throw kimchi in there. 

I thought the best one was the Cali Slider. The ground beef patty was salty enough and was cooked pretty well; it had a nice pink color on the inside. The balsamic onions were too strong, though. Some bites only tasted like tart balsamic. It would be a lot better if they just used plain old caramelized onions.
author: Nei N.

description:
We so not happy!  We were nearby at Costco & wanted to check out SoMA Streat Eats.  We decided on sharing the Cali Sliders (2 for $8).  There was a also a check in deal on Yelp for free garlic fries with purchase...score!  The guy taking our order asked how we wanted them and we said medium.  

The sliders were topped with bacon, balsamic caramelized onions and Gorgonzola cheese.  I liked how the sliders were a little different with the use of Gorgonzola.  The burgers were cooked more well done than medium and weren't juicy at all.  Bf also pointed out that they were pretty thin, and that usually with sliders they compensate for the size of the overall burger with a little thicker of a patty.  The garlic fries were perfectly crisp, but I couldn't really taste the garlic or much of the parm cheese.  

Would not come back.  At least the fries were free and the guys were quick with cranking out the order.  I think I'll stick to restaurants for sliders/burgers.
author: Cat C.

description:
Went to Me So Hungry food truck at Off the Grid in Menlo Park. Tried to order the KTM sliders but they said it would take 40 minutes. No big deal, ordered the monster burger instead, medium rare.

When I got the burger I cut it in half to share with my wife and the center was raw. Took it back to them and asked if they could cook it a little more. They told me that it was correctly cooked as medium rare and that I must have wanted medium. If they had cooked it any less it would've been essentially a pile of raw meat, but whatever, maybe I'm wrong. I'm willing to be wrong so long as they fix the problem. 

To solve the problem, they took the two halves of the burger and placed them face down on the grill for about 30 seconds. The result is that the greens got soggy and weird, while the centers of each side were still pretty raw. I threw it away. It would've taken about 1 minute to lift the patty off the burger and put it back on the grill in the usual way. They didn't seem particularly rushed or busy. Not going back again.
author: Michael K.

description:
I ordered the Duke burger ($12 + tax, no fries) which is essentially a western bacon burger on cheesy texas toast, which sounds amazing, but it was merely alright.  

The biggest weakness was that it was too dry, which is probably a design flaw, and not that I got a bad batch.  They're not doomed by any stretch, but I would recommend revising the formula for the Duke at least, because I've had much better burgers for much less.
author: Carlin F.

description:
When Me So Hungry pulled into Off the Grid at UN Plaza, its Pink & Black truck definitely stood out among the company. I opted for the slider sampler platter for $11 and my tastebuds were more than happy.

The Cali Slider features angus beef with smoked applewood bacon, balsamic sauteed onions, and gorgonzola cheese. I found my beef patty a little dry, but the balsamic onions were to die for! 

The KTM features kahlua marinated short ribs, pepper jack cheese, crispy onions and a spicy creme fraiche sauce. The rib meat was juicy, but looked more like tiny pieces of beef rather than a solid, tender almost pulled pork style of meat. Either way, it was melt in your mouth goodness.

The Flyin' Hawaiian features shredded chicken, crispy maui onions, and chipotle aioli. It was a mix of sweet, spicy, and tangy...so so SO GOOD. 

Needless to say, I was very satisfied.
author: Elaine Y.

description: This is the 2nd time that I have ordered the Cali Burger with Balsamic onions, and Gorgonzola Cheese. I don't care for Gorgonzola, but this combination works and makes this hamburger delicious. The garlic sweet potatoe fries are also delicious with the creme fraiche dressing.
author: Sepas K.

description:
My friend was really upset when their review mysteriously disappeared from here.  If censorship is more important than honesty then it tells you quite a bit about this business.  I'm re-posting our experience...

The short version: Our first experience with this truck we witnessed two of the workers smoking pot at the back of the truck.  One identified themselves as the owner and pointed out his brother as "partners in crime".  Our second experience with the truck we saw the self-proclaimed owner again - this time smoking a cigarette *INSIDE* the truck.

Between the mediocre food, unprofessional staff, and health code violations, you should stay away from this place unless they make some serious changes.
author: Ben F.

description:
Came across the Me So Hungry food truck outside of an event I was attending at Mighty and I'm so happy I found this culinary gem. I was definitely hungry and in the mood for some quality food. It was perfect timing because after looking through the delicious menu, I realized this was gourmet munchie heaven!

I had no idea where to start so Mark gave me wonderful guidance on the menu. I was looking at the flyin hawaiian sliders (chicken) but also short rib sliders (forgot the name). So with Mark's help and his special culinary abilities, he made me the short rib sliders but instead of on the brioche buns (I prefer gluten free) he put them on sweet potato fries. Not sure what to call it but we mixed short rib, fries, extra sauce, topped with sriracha drizzle. 

Overall Mark  provided one of the best food truck meals I've ever had, and made the whole experience perfect. If you see Me So Hungry Truck out and about, you must stop by!
author: Maddy M.

description: I had the most amazing sliders here with sweet potato fries. Cali Sliders were the best!! There is a ton of seating in the Streat Park so you can get drinks and dessert after at the other food trucks. Sounds like a plan to me!
author: Jane H.

description: Had the chicken and sweet potato fries at SfO. Moist, sweet spicy pulled chicken. Delicious!
author: vac m.

description:
Bottom line, disappointing.  Wouldn't order again.

Tried them this afternoon at Moveable Feast in Foster City.  The Flyin' Hawaiian slider was nothing special and lacked flavor.  I did like the crispy Maui onions, but I wish there'd been more of the chipotle aioli.  The garlic Parmesan sweet potato fries were terrible, and definitely not worth the $5+.  They were limp and not even very warm, and the spicy creme fraiche served on the side didn't do much for them.  Wish I'd used my $12 for food from just about any of the other trucks at the event.
author: Shana O.

description:
If it weren't for the sliders actually being good I would have given 1 star. We ordered 2 sliders and 1 regular garlic parm fries, it took almost 30 mins for the food to come out. The fries were sweet potato, so we gave the fries back to him (through the window), which took another 15 minutes of waiting to get those. We had to tell the person in the window three times what we were waiting for. The third time we said something we got our fries and they were cold. 

A person next to us, told us that the guy in the truck told her that they were out of sweet potato fries, then noticed miraculously had more..hmm.. so seems as though they had just re-purposed our fries... grosssss. 

(FYI - this was the start of an event we went to and was not a good way to start out)
author: chris h.

description:
Stood in line for over 20 minutes with the intent to buy dessert. .. no one keeps me away from mah sugar! Haha

Anyways stood in line HELLA long only to get up to the front to be told that they're not doing desserts tonight .... MEH!

Cool thanks for not crossing it off your menu and wasting my time in the cold wanting maple donuts WITH BACON and Banana CREAM puffs!!
author: Natasha S.

description:
Where are all these 5 star reviews coming from?!?!?

Oh yah: http://bit.ly/16f0nKs 
(It was a picture from the business offering Yelpers a free meal in exchange for a 5 star review but "someone" flagged it and it got removed.)

Perhaps Yelpers should start using their "elite" status to get free drinks/meals at other joints. I sure as hell wouldn't be broke anymore... *Woot*

OTHER NOTES:
*Ridiculously long wait for sliders. Female cashier wasn't friendly.
--It shouldn't take over 20 minutes to cook small, thin patties. Friends who ordered food from other trucks, got their food, ate theirs and our order was still not ready. 
*Only two sliders available at SoMa StrEat Food Park last week (sold out of KTM: Short Rib): http://bit.ly/1aSTBev
--Cali Slider: Angus Beef w/ Gorgonzola & Bacon (2 for $8)
--Flyin' Hawaiian Slider: Pulled Chicken w/ Chipotle Aioli & Maui Onions (2 for $8)
*Free Garlic Parmesan Fries if you check-in on Yelp (regularly $4). Thank goodness they were free because they were neither garlicky or cheesy; just super salty. 
*Sliders were nothing special and mediocre at best. They were also deceivingly larger than they actually were (mainly bread). 
--Cali Slider was overcooked (well-done) and dry. Didn't taste much gorgonzola but bacon was nicely crisp. 
--Flyin' Hawaiian Slider was gross. Dry, pulled chicken mixed with something that tasted like Thai sweet chili sauce used for dipping egg rolls; it was just way too sweet. Where were the maui onions? =(
*3 generous stars but minus 1 star for offering Yelpers a free meal in exchange for a 5 star review. Shady.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Me So Hungry offers sliders of various interesting names. (see website for details)

locale: eat real fest(9/27)
eats: cali slider(5)
-angus beef pattie w/ smoked applewood bacon
-balsamic sauteed onions
-gorgonzola cheese
patty chewy, dry, some bacon taste, otherwise bland, pricey
-slider small
2.5 stars

notes:
-took 20 minutes for burger to come out, only 1 other person in line.
-juhu street food's "holy cow" slider tasted better,
author: Victor G.

description:
I've ordered from this truck before and recall that they weren't bad.  Obviously my mind had changed since then.  

I got off work late but was meeting with friends for drinks later in the day.  The bar we were going to didn't have food so we opted to get food here (thinking it would be quick and easy).  Much to our dismay, eating here too 30-40 minutes.  First of all the line is hardly moving, and sometimes they are so backed up that they aren't even taking orders.  Once your order has been placed be prepare to wait forever once again.  After we placed our order, I went to the neighboring food truck, placed an order, received it, and finished it before our order at Me So Hungry was even ready.

The food itself isn't bad, but REALLY not worth the wait.  Had I known it would have taken this long I would just gone to a restaurant.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Friendly, fast and freaking delicious.

The flavor packed into these little sliders are great but the value is not the best. The price at around $1/bite isn't worth it. Especially since this is outdoors and surrounded by generators at the Soma StrEat Food Park. 

Sprig or Munchree are about same price for similar quality but with out the sound of generators and all that. The drawback with those services is you have to be at home and have someone deliver the food to you.
author: Justin S.

description:
***3.5 stars***

i checked out this food truck when i visited the palo alto edition of moveable feast a few months ago.

for me, the big selling point was the sweet potato fries, since i'm a sucker for these slightly sweet, yet salty munchies.

my sweet potato fries came out hot, crispy and were garnished with parmesan cheese, garlic, and parsley.  this was a good size portion for $4.  they were delicious, and gone in a matter of minutes!  

i also ordered the veggie slider, which was tasty, but on the small side, and certainly not worth the $4 that i paid.

overall, an above average experience, but i wouldn't be running back here anytime soon, unless i had a serious craving for sweet potato fries!

note that credit card transactions are only accepted for purchases over $5, so if you're just getting 1 item, be sure to have cash on you!
author: Ellen L.

description:
Really underwhelming.

I got three sliders: Cali, whatever the Hawaiian chicken one is called, and the the rib one. I also got sweet potato fries.

I asked for the Cali one without Gorgonzola. It came with Gorgonzola.

I asked for the sweet potato fries without Parmesan. They came with Parmesan.

The burger and rib sliders were alright but no great shakes. The chicken one was a sickly-sweet abomination.

Plus the wait was _so_ long.
author: Adriana V.

description:
Lets face it - most sliders suck! They were never meant to be taken seriously. If you wanted a burger, you would order a burger! 

2/10 sliders i've had in my life are probably worth mentioning, but they always use special toppings. Slowly roasted duck or pork on anything taste good, but here at "Me So Hungry" - which probably comes from the original phrase "Me so horny" {Pause for laughter}.

The cali sliders was a perfect blend of meat and cheese. Ill admit that the patty were on the thinner side, but i'm fine with that. The thick bacon and cheese added a nice touch to it. I wish they offered it in a normal size burger. LIke offer two sizes - slider and burger size. I eat fast, so it took me a total of 8 bites to finish both sliders. 

The Free parmesan fries did not impress me at all tho. Although they were perfectly cooked, it was a unbalance taste of lots of garlic on some fries and a hit of cheese on the other fries. I would just get normal fries. 

All in all - I'm a fan. If i saw this truck again i would go back if i was craving for burgers!
author: Ryan R.

description: Johnny and team are the bees knees! We request MeSoHungry for our large events twice a year. Our guests love them, the food is spectacular, and the staff is accommodating. Will def use again.
author: Renee S.

description:
This food truck has stopped by my campus a few times. I usually get something when it's there and I usually enjoy the food. 

I've tried both fries (garlic parm & garlic parm sweet potato). Both are awesome and I normally never eat too many fries at once. My boyfriend loves them too and he ate my leftovers. I do notice that they give less fries when their venue is on campus compared to if they were at an Off the Grid event which I do not like. That alone made me not want to buy their food on campus as much.

I've had all the sliders because I usually get slider samplers (i like variety). I think I liked the Cali sliders the most but wasn't too sure about the gorgonzola. The KTM and the Hawaiian are great too but definitely different flavors. 

I've also tried the banana caramel bread brioche (or something) which were also good, just very heavy and a big portion. It also sucks when the whipped cream melts off when you let it sit to eat your savory food first. 

Overall, great food. Good service. Bold flavors.
author: Sofia R.

description: I am very disappointed. I have been wanting to try the food for quite sometime. I thought I would go out on a limb and try the PB&J burger. When you go to their website and click on that menu item, there is clearly a burger patty between those buns. When I received the "burger," it was merely a bun, sauces, cheese, and bacon. I called and asked if there was supposed to be meat and the guy told me no, only bacon. Just know if you order this, there is NO burger patty. One would think for $11 it would have a burger patty. On top of my disappointment, the bottom was burnt and I ended up throwing it away. Ugh.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I had the slider sampler, sweet potato fries and brioche donuts with bacon crumble(chef special).

The donuts weren't too special.

The sweet potato fries were really good, especially with the spicy creme fraiche sauce.  It was a nice take on classic sweet potato fries.

The sliders were where the meal really stood out:
First of all, the bread is amazing.  They are brioche, so they are very tender and moist.

The Cali Sliders were good, but pretty standard bacon hamburger stuff.

The KTM and Flyin' Hawaiian sliders on the other hand were outstanding.  So moist and flavorful.  Great combination of flavors.
author: Jason S.

description:
Came here after a good work out at Mission Cliffs.  I asked for one KTM ($9) and garlic fries($4).  After the superfriendlyawesome lady rang me up, she asked if I wanted ONE or an order of the KTM (an order comes with 2 sliders).  The total was 49 and some change. 

While waiting for my order, I asked myself, "Hmm, 9+4=13 but I only paid $9.  Did they  forget my fries?"  So I walked to the counter, 
Me:  "Excuse me, did I order fries?"
Lady:  Shouts to the Chef, "Did Linda order fries?"
Chef:  "Yes!"
Lady:  (Steps off the food truck and walks towards me) "I only charged you for one slider, otherwise the total would've been $13.
Me:  "Oh wow, are you sure?"
Lady:  Yeah don't worry about it"
Me:  (with the biggest smile on my face) "Thank you!" =)

Besides climbing to the top of a very high wall, this was the highlight of my day.  

The KTM was good.  I like the crispy onions- adds texture to the slider.  They don't skimp on the fries either.

Very friendly staff.
author: Linda N.

description:
I don't know why this place doesn't have more reviews. But I've had a run in with this truck twice and it has never disappointed.

Do the Garlic Fries, and I've had the Cali, KT, and and Flyin Hawaiian. Try them all. My favorite was the Flyin Hawaiian surprisingly.
author: Tiffanie T.

description:
Angus beef teriyaki sliders ... I think I've sold my soul.

I haven't enjoyed a burger that much since my first visit to Umami. The teriyaki sauce was rich and intense. This food truck needs to start making rounds at Soma StrEAT Food Park.
author: Nathan Y.

description:
(Review is just for their food truck.)

The Cali Sliders are DELICIOUS!!! Fresh, high quality ingredients and great service!
author: Melanie W.

description: Went to the Soma Street food park on a Sunday. Lots of choices and options on food trucks but it was a beautiful day for a burger. Must order on Monster Burger and Garlic Fries sasitfied that it was hella fat bruh.
author: Chris R.

description:
The KTM sliders are my new flavortown tenderoni :D 

The onion rings are perfectly dry and crispy crunchy and the meat is melt in your mouth delicious. I also loved the brioche bunz! 

Next time I'll order these sliders dry without the sauce and cheese to minimize the guilt.
author: Jacquee P.

description:
Still happy.

First visit left me smiling over two years ago. Been wanting to return and try their homemade veggie burger.

One bite into the rich cheese and grains patty topped with lettuce and balsamic sauteed onions knew it was worth the wait. Cheese sauce comes standard too.

Any full-size $10 burger better be worth it. This one was both in flavor and size. With more discipline it could have been two meals.

Happy and apparently hungry.
author: Jason B.

description: My Employer hired Me So Hungry food truck to come on site in Mountain View and provide our group lunch today.  We lined up at noon and by the time I got my food it was 1:15.  Can't believe I waited in line so long.  Not only was the line long but they ran out of some food.  I ordered the Cali Slider and KTM Slider but then when my order was near being ready, they told me they ran out of KTM sliders.  Apparently they don't keep good track of their inventory to know how many burgers they have.  So I switched to 2 Cali Sliders and a side of sweet potato fries.  I was surprised to find my fries cool and sort of limp.  My first Cali burger wasn't hot either.  It was room temperature.  It tasted OK.  The meat didn't have any char to it so it was sort of bland but the bacon helped add flavor.  After I bit into my 2nd Cali burger, I saw it was raw in the middle (I'm posting a picture).  I had already swallowed the first bite so I'm hoping I don't get sick.  I can't believe the burger is raw in the middle.  I know they are rushing to get everyone served but raw hamburger meat can make someone sick.  This is unacceptable.
author: Lily L.

description: Me So Hungry was at SOMA Streat Park one weekend, and there was no line AWESOME! The Cali Slider was the most impressive on their menu and it was awesome. There were so many dimensions of flavor and the patty was cooked perfectly and juicy. Although it was called a "slider" it was definitely bigger than your average slider, which I appreciate. There was some meat on that guy and it was delicious!
author: Vanessa K.

description: Me So Hungry is how I described myself after their so-called "Monster Burger." 50 minutes in line and $13 bucks for a small patty (guessing less than 1/4 lb.). Huge disconnect between how they describe themselves and what you actually get, especially with the significant time investment and cost.
author: Scott P.

description:
I heard about this place from friends and had to try it when they came to evergreen's off the grid. Ordered the slider sampler which came with

The Cali - marinated chicken breast, Maui onions and chipotle aioli
Flyin' Hawaiian - angus beef, applewood  bacon, balsamic onions, and gorgonzola. 
The KTM - short ribs, pepper jack cheese, onions and their signature creme friache sauce.

And an order of garlic parmesan fries. 

They had the longest line in comparison to the other food trucks and took that as a good sign. Got to the window, and they were almost out of everything but the wait wasn't bad - just about 10 - 15 minutes. The buns all have a nice toasty-ness to them but of the three sliders, I enjoyed the KTM the most. The garlic fries were nothing special so I'd suggest getting either the onion rings or the sweet potato fries which were better seeing as I picked off my friends'. 

Overall, I was expecting a bit more, but I'd go again to try their other items.
author: Mariel L.

description:
This review is solely based on service.  I would like to have been able to write a review based on the food; however, after waiting in line for a good 20+ minutes I decided to opt out and take my business to a neighboring food truck.  It seemed that whoever was taking orders, was only taking 1 every 5 min.  After she would take an order she would disappear into the truck but could be seen laughing and joking around with coworkers.  My boyfriend (who opted for a truck with a longer line than this one had) received his food and would have been finished long before I would have received any service if I had not opted to go elsewhere.  

In short, "Me So Hungry" will leave you feeling just that.
author: Rachael S.

description: The food was delicious!  From the garlic fries, sliders to the customer service was five star!  The Hawaiian chicken slider had so much flavor explosion and had just the right sweetness to it, I wanted more! Give me more now!  I needed a bag and the owner went out of his way to wrap up our food so that I can carry everything myself because I had a toddler with me and you know they are a hand full.  The truck was eye catching and pretty.  The garlic fries were also perfect, they stayed crispy for a long time and had the right balance not to salty but just right. Keep doing what you do! Can't wait to eat some more soon!
author: Austi And London's Mommy N.

description: Yummy... I had the chicken onion slider OMY ... So good can't wait till Friday when the trucks come to Pleasanton again
author: Patricia J.

description: The garlic Parmesan fries were amazing. Definitely try those! I like that they have vegetarian options in both the burgers and the sliders. I had a Portobello slider, which was a special that day. Very tasty, and the perfect size for a meal. It had little crunchy onions inside that made the whole dish even better. I felt that it was a tad expensive, though.
author: Patti M.

description:
I love the idea of different sliders for lunch because I get to sample a bunch of different things all in the same meal. Maybe I over-hyped the sliders in my head prior to coming here. I had a great lunch, but thought it was a little bit expensive for what it was, and the fillings were't quite as flavorful as I would have liked.

I split a bunch of sliders with my friend so that we could try different flavors. 

Cali Sliders ($8 for 2 sliders) - Angus, Smoked Apple-Wood Bacon, Balsamic Sauteed Onions - Good flavor; meat patty was a bit thin for $4 per slider. I did like the bacon and onion. 

KTM Sliders ($9 for 2 slides) - w/ Marinated Short Ribs, Pepper Jack Cheese, Crispy Onions and Spicy Spicy Crème Fraîche - I liked the combo of the short ribs. The cheese and onions were a great complement to the meat.

Flyin' Hawaiian Sliders ($8 for 2 sliders) - w/ Chicken, Crispy Maui Onions and Chipotle Aioli - Tasted more like just shredded chicken on a bun. Thought it would be more flavorful.

Sweet Potato Fries ($4) - Crispy and well-prepared; I love sweet potato fries, and these did not disappoint.

My friend and I each got 2 sliders which was more than enough food for me to eat (including the fries). I wish I could give this a higher rating, but I didn't feel like the sliders had quite enough things on it or flavors. It's not exactly a healthy lunch, nor inexpensive, so I don't think I'll be back often :/
author: Christina L.

description:
Bummer, I really wanted to love the sliders, what with their cool names and such, but couldn't get excited about any of them.  
- The Calilfornia had gorgonzola and bacon, but it was tough to taste either...
- The KTM was probably the best with its short ribs but not as juicy as the Korean magic you're probably expecting
- The flyin hawaiian tasted oddly like sweet and sour chicken from an American Chinese restaurant, which was kind of weird...

But the garlic fries were a winner!  And tasty with the sauces they have.
author: Aaron M.

description: I'm not such a big fun of burgers, but how this guys made chicken burgers it's crazy! Very delicious and bread have some special sauce...mmmm! I can call this chiken burger genius, because it's balanced and tast.
author: Ilya V.

description:
Ordered the Sampler (one each of the meat sliders) and the Sweet Potato Fries (with Spicy Crème Fraîche ). 

Over $17, plus I tipped 20%.

Pork slider:  Weird taste makes me think of a church pot-luck casserole. Just too many things going on, and I couldn't pick out any specific flavor. The occasional crunchy onion was nice, but in general there was something icky about it, the way that pasta salad made by someone else's mom is icky. 

Chicken slider:  Very similar experience to the pork slider. The toppings all sounded amazing on the menu, but in the end it was like eating a slightly spicy coleslaw made with warm chicken instead of cabbage.

Beef slider (burger): Nice beef but overwhelmed by blue cheese (gorganzola?) sauce. There wasn't that much sauce, it was just really strong. I could occasionally taste the bacon, but not often. Didn't notice the onions. Again...Too many things going on at once.

What I was really looking forward to were the sweet potato fries with the spicy crème fraîche. It's too bad that what they gave me was sweet potato fries with garlic and cheese. No spicy crème fraîche to be found.

Not sure what happened there. I was the only person in line. Nobody behind me. I said, "sweet potato Fries with the crème fraîche." Don't know how that got confused, especially since the menu clearly states that the sweet potato fries come with spicy crème fraîche. Now I just have this pile of dry, garlicky fries that's not really doing anything for me.

For $17+ please get my order right, especially when I'm the only one in line to order.

After reading some other reviews it seems that the crème fraîche is in a little cup on the side. Not sure why I didn't get one, since I specifically asked for it and it seems to be part of the menu item. 

In general I'm not really into "pulled meat" sliders, I just wanted to try them to get the full experience. I do like a good beef-burger slider, but this one just didn't do it for me. The next time I have a slider craving I'll save it and head to Phil's in Berkeley.
author: Alex K.

description: $$$$ wayyyy over priced. After denying me my first two options, I settled for the $10, under seasoned, bland, short rib sliders smaller than my palm. The "spicy creme fraiche" was a food dyed, Elmer's paste. The bun just sucked. Not going to try this again.
author: Ryne O.

description: The smell enticed me to try these burgers today... totally deceiving.   They were out of all regular size burgers and had no fries.  I ended up with two veggie sliders... overpriced and flavorless.  Never again.
author: Sofia V.

description:
I wasn't so hungry and was a bit tipsy when I tried this food truck in the alleyway in front of Otis(maiden lane by union square). It was cool that the first thing they offered was free fries if we checked in so we just ordered sliders to go along with the fries.

We tried the Cali and the KTM sliders and both were good but not great. Plus, being tipsy probably made them taste even better than if we were sober and our tastebuds were not numb from the alcohol.

Food Highlight: Their fries were surprisingly good and being parked in front of a bar for quick and easy access is always a plus
author: Rich L.

description: Slowest food truck ever. I waited 30+ minutes for my food last week. Was it worth the wait? Nope, nothing extraordinary about it.
author: Kazu O.

description: Got to taste their KTM sliders while at the Annual Ghost Ship Halloween Party's new location, Pier 70. Their truck was the one that had the most people in line compared to the other food trucks. The KTM's flavor was pretty good. However, I think a lot came from the fatty part of the meat. Still, pretty darn good! My wife had their veggie slider and she enjoyed it. Yes, the wait time of standing in line to order and the price to pay seemed a bit high. The people working there were friendly enough, too.
author: Eric D.

description:
Reposting after review was removed...

Food trucks normally offer their customer three things - good food, delivered quickly, where you want it. We tried Me So Hungry at America's Cup Park and unfortunately they could only get the location right.

We stood in line for 15 minutes to order (just 5 people / 3 orders ahead of us), and it took an extra 25+ minutes to prepare and deliver an average meal. You know it's bad when sitting down at the burger place across the street would have been faster. At least Me So Hungry lives up to their brand promise - they keep their customers hungry!

Avoid at all costs.
author: Nigel G.

description:
Despite its pretentiousness even for a food truck, this truck actually has some good food, provided that they don't actually run out of it.

Tried out their KTM sliders and they didn't disappoint. The marinated short ribs are incredibly tender and the other toppings are actually light enough that it doesn't overwhelm the flavor of the meat. I was disappointed by their lack of the bacon covered maple donuts and the fact that they ran out of garlic for their fries.
author: Ian L.

description: This place is simply the best. I cannot give a better description of my desire for me so hungry, as it's quiet simply my favorite food here in San Francisco. Love ya guys! Keep up the consistent amazingness!
author: Vadim F.

description:
The long line at this truck at the Streat Bazaar tonight made me think that it must be popular (also could be because options were slim pickins tonight) but once I got into the line I realized it was long because it wasn't moving. I waited in line for about 20 minutes then waited for my order for another 15. Upon receiving my order, the employee handed it down to me and then quickly turned away to get more orders- no "thank you", no "napkins are right here" or "enjoy", nothing. I had to stand there and wait for him to come back so I could complete my order because  they gave no dipping sauce with the garlic fries. When I asked for some the guy looked stressed out by me and said "50 cents" to which I responded "k I'll go get 50 cents for you and come back" to that he just impatiently shrugged and handed me the ketchup. 

As for the food- no dice. The fries were OKAY, crispy but very dry and very little garlic on them. The Flyin Hawaiian chicken sliders were AWFUL. They didn't seem to have anything on them except this shredded chicken that was drenched in the most cloyingly sweet sauce imaginable. The sauce had no other flavor aside from sugar. How is this a Hawaiian slider? The way I imagine they made this slider is they shredded some dry over-baked chicken and then let it swim in a tub of simple syrup for a few hours then put it on some mediocre buns and send it out. It wasn't even warm. Seriously bad. 
When you're making 3 diff types of slider, one of which u are sold out of, and sweet potato and regular fries and that's it, there's no excuse for taking as long as these guys did tonight. Furthermore, an apology for said wait and some gratitude for the business upon FINALLY handing over the orders would go a long way.
author: Emma H.

description: As a girl with many food allergies and intolerance's, I was super excited to see this healthy alternative outside the club last night. I only eat organic when possible and free range/grass fed.I ordered a plain patty with just lettuce and tomoatoes since I can't have any dairy, gluten, and a side of sweet potato fries plain. I was so excited to be able to eat out like a normal person for once, and it was totally unexpected! Thank you so much for the great service and flavorful street food! It was amazing.
author: Isabel V.

description: Great bacon burger and amazing maple bacon donuts! Highly recommend. Amazing looking sliders didn't get to try it. Needed more sauce in the burger but I didn't get the cheddar cheese so I can't blame them.
author: David S.

description:
Not really worth the wait for my tasting. I waited for maybe 20 min, which is 30% of my lunch hour and the food I got in return wasn't as good as I was expecting. 

I got the Cali sliders ($9). It was 2 pretty good sized burgerettes. The burgers were tasty and fulfilling. 

I also got the sweet potato garlic fries. I'm not sure why, I don't even like sweet potato fries, and they weren't that great to me. To add onto the okayness - they "forgot" ketchup that day. Weird. The sweet potato fries were $4. 

For a $13 meal, I wanted a bit more. Idk if it was up to par with my food truck standard.
author: Junel S.

description:
LOVE when there is catered food truck lunches! However, I was pretty unsatisfied with the what I got. You'd think from the name they serve something around Japanese fusion cuisine (Me So = Miso...or nawe?) but nope these guys dish out sliders and fries! 

From the limited selection of options, I got myself the Cali Slider with a side of regular fries. The Cali Slider came with Angus, Smoked Apple-Wood Bacon, Balsamic Sauteed Onions, and Gorgonzola Cheese Sauce. I'm a huuuuge fan of cheese so I had to try out the gorgonzola cheese sauce and not going to lie, it was quite unique for my taste. I wish they had just thrown on actual gorgonzola cheese rather than making it into a sauce.

The Sliders were average. I loved the onions but balsamic sauteed onions literally taste good on anything! 

Unfortunately, I don't think I'll be back. Sliders and fries were pretty average.
author: Jo L.

description: I love love love food trucks.  I was very excited to see a few at the Cal opening game and decided to try this place out.  I got the KCM short rib sliders and I was really disappointed.  It was super greasy and ridiculously hard to eat because it was just getting everywhere.  The buns were good though... I'll give them that.  Anyways, they had a sauce in the middle and that was good... like really good, but it was just in the middle.  If they gave me more I'd be a lot happier.  Also, it's super expensive and they charged me twice!!  Hopefully that gets resolved tomorrow and I get my refund.
author: Kenitha Y.

description:
FOOD: If you're a fan of sliders, you would be a fan of Me So Hungry. Their meat is well seasoned and juicy tender the way I like it. They have several meat options as well. The proportions are just right because you do not want to over stuff yourself. I'm not fan of garlic fries, but I've tasted theirs and it was very delicious! It wasn't overpowering at all and just a right amount of garlic seasoning. 

SERVICE: The service is quick and efficient. I was at the Soma Streat Food Park. One time I left the food truck for a quick second and one of the cooks found me within the food park to hand deliver me the food. Talk about prime customer service! 

PRICE: The prices are reasonable food truck prices from $8-10.. the price is well worth it. 

OVERALL: I would definitely recommend this food truck. Good people. Good sliders. Good vibes.
author: Isabel N.

description:
I got the KCM short rib sliders and was pretty disappointed. There was no line and I got my order within a couple minutes, so I was surprised the sliders were a bit cold, definitely not warm. The jack cheese wasn't even melted, and seemed to have an odd aftertaste. The short ribs were glazed in this sauce that I thought was way too sweet. I mean yeah, it's personal preference I guess, but I just can't see too many people raving about this sauce. 

Now it's a few hours after eating the sliders, and I am not feeling that great. My stomach is clearly frustrated with me for eating them. Unless this is the only food truck around, I will most likely not be trying this truck again, even if mesohungry.
author: Leo G.

description:
I am automatically drawn to anything that pays homage to 80s & 90s rap, even if it's notoriously bad rap ("not bad meaning bad, but bad meaning good" *poses with arms crossed over chest b-boy style*) The name Me So Hungry--me so likey!

The black & pink truck was parked at the SOMA streat food park for Sunday brunch. We ordered the slider sampler ($11.) The lowdown: 
-- the Flyin' Hawaiian: shredded chicken with a sweet & tangy sauce...a little too sweet. Like the crispy Maui onions.  
-- KTM: short ribs with a spicy sauce. A little fatty; tender & delectable . 
-- Cali: angus beef slider. Did not try. 

Satisfied with what I tried once, but have no desire to go back.
author: Fancypants X.

description: A client invited me to her company lunch catered by these guys. We waited about ten minutes for our food & it was worth the wait. Super delish! I'll definitely be hunting the down the next time I'm in the city.
author: Shandrea B.

description: Hawaiian Sliders hit the spot, for a quick meal. This sauce is not overwhelming, and buns are toasted just right.
author: Wynton F.

description:
Me So Hungry was at Drake's Brewery on a beautiful Sunday afternoon. Staff was friendly at ordering and at food pick-up. A trio of sliders and a couple sweet potato fries were ordered - the sampler was the chicken and double on beef since the KTM was out of stock - I wasn't intrigued by the vegetarian option but also, didn't notice it since it wasn't on the picture menu, only the left side written menu with the event specific prices. The yam frites are a great option and much preferred over onion rings and potatoes but they were clearly a) frozen and b) lukewarm although there was a steady supply of customers. I picked up the food immediately when they called my name as my party was hungry after riding 30+ miles to the destination. 

The two sauces provided to customers, were also required, for both the sliders and frites, one was a ketchup like sauce and the other was a mayonnaise heavy thousand island type. There were little nutrients by way of greens in the meal, both of which could have enhanced the texture, flavor, appearance and depth of the offerings.  That I remember the sauces more than the substance of the main food should reveal why I've experienced plenty better. I saw a Duke come out which appeared more substantial at least visually. On that, perhaps avoiding the sliders for the full sandwiches is a better route. 

I was glad the truck was at the brewery (although there were a number of restaurants in the nearby vicinity that could have been optioned instead). Credit card was accepted. Pricing was typical, expected for the food truck experience - $22 for one slider sampler and two sweet potato fries - just shy of a comparable meal recently enjoyed at Gott's SF which provided seating, water, condiments, and warmth - all with the overhead of the most prime retail space in SF. Come to think of it, the pricing then was too high. Total wait time, prep, and delivery took 45 minutes. The saving grace was the company, great people to hang out with while in line and great people to hang out with while waiting for the food.
author: Wilson T.

description:
We had lunch brought to us , so this about the food not the pricing  :)

I was HUNGRY , and we had a few options but my choice was the Cali Sliders (2) , Angus Beef, with Smoked Apple Wood Bacon, PLUS , Sauteed Onions and Gorgonzola with a side of Sweet Potato Fries w Spicy Frache,  

Can we say YUM,  The Beef was well cooked which is my preference, and topped with  the decadent trio of Onions, cheese , and Bacon it was a win for me , as for the Fries , they were Shoe String cut and oh so good with that light cheese topping ,  

Me So Hungry is such an easy recommend if you looking to fill your meat craving !
author: Joseph A.

description:
I contacted Me So Hungry for a corporate event we had for work and was put in touch with Jerry, the owner . Jerry was greatly responsive and he worked with me on my budget and created a special menu for the vegetarians as my boss is vegetarian. 

On the day of the event, they came early and were set up and ready before the guests arrive.  They were also really nice to our guests, and continued to joke around with them and make sure everyone was in a good/festive mood.

Great/professional experience.  I would use them again and would refer them to my friends.  =)
author: Vi Y.

description: 2 sliders for 10.50? C'mon son. They were decent but was still left hungry and couldn't justify spending another $5 for fries.
author: justin p.

description: The monster burger was cooked to perfection! The atmosphere was rendezvous especially accompanied with the sweet potato fries cooked to perfection! The best part of my duhhh-mazing meal was the delightful little girl who sold it all. Fire!
author: Richmond R.

description:
Meh. Tried them out at SoMa StrEat Food Park.

Service
I asked for the slider sample (3 sliders of my choice). I asked for two of the KTM (marinated short ribs) and one Cali (w/ bacon and gorgonzola). The cashier was nice, and while still waiting, I asked to use my Yelp check-in offer for an order of fries, and he honored that.

The wait was pretty long. Sliders are small, it shouldn't take that long to cook a mini-patty and dress some buns. When I got my order, it was wrong. They had given me one each of their three regular sliders, instead of the 2-KTM-1-Cali that I had asked for.

Food
The biggest disappointment to all of this was that the food wasn't even good. The KTM was probably the best, but the Cali had a thin patty that was overcooked. The bacon on it wasn't crispy. And those fries, even though they were free, were just not good. They tasted a bit stale, weren't crispy enough, and needed some salt. I didn't even bother trying to finish the fries.


VERDICT: I would not return.
author: James T.

description:
Had a pretty bland experience last night. I got the Duke burger, my friend got a cheeseburger and we shared some sweet potato fries. 

Everything was cold, took 20 minutes for them to get our order, including tip it came out to 25 bucks and we didn't even get beverages. Really, really bland. Not a fan.
author: Dylan S.

description:
Ordered the Cali and KMZ sliders with garlic fries. The Cali had a very small patty and over cooked, even though I ordered medium-rare, the outcome was dry and unflavorful. The fries were so over seasoned that I can see a heavy coating of table salt on top -- yuk! Tossed out half of the fries which BTW were $4.

$12 for over seasoned food. Blah, will not eat there again.
author: J. Y.

description: The truck came to the hospital where I work and the food was pretty good, portions generous, staff are polite, however, it took 45 minutes for my order and everyone else's which is not feasible in my work setting.  I don't quite understand why it took so long.  It wasn't that busy.  By the time I was able to sit down to eat I had lost my appetite and had to give half of my meal away.  $14 for 2 sliders and garlic fries is steep for what it is and certainly not worth the wait.  I do appreciate that they take credit card payments.
author: Christina J.

description:
Run don't walk...I said run away from this food truck!!

The sliders were served cold and I mean ice cold not heat what so ever.
The best part is I waited 8 minutes or so for cold food.  On a happy note, the staff was nice and friendly.
author: Dionne M.

description:
I tried the Cali sliders and the Garlic Parmesan Fries and damn I was blown away. The sliders had a good combination of flavors. From the tender beef, to the bacon, to the savory sauce on top, the slider was masterfully prepared. You would never expect such a small thing to have so much flavor! The fries were crispy and delicious and complimented the sliders well. I wish they were less oily, but there's only so much you can expect from burgers and fries! They were still a devilishly delicious combo. 

The wait is pretty damn long for a food truck, which is why they lose a star. A few coworkers and I ended up waiting a ridiculously long time for all of our orders to come out. So long, that the guy that got his order first ended up finishing his meal by the time the last order came out. Wait time aside, the experience was good! Definitely give these sliders a chance if you have the time!
author: Dan K.

description:
Ive had the cali sliders many times and it is always awesome! Last week I decided to switch it up and order the DUKE because I was really hungry that day. This burger comes on cheese bread with bbq sauce and one onion ring and a few other things I told the man at the truck I would like my burger cooked medium.

My order came up and I left to go back to work and enjoy my lunch but it was anything but that it was so so greasy I mean it literally poured off the burger on top of that it was extremely well done. The burger had a different taste to it too more of a gamey meat taste Definitely will never order that again.
author: Michael W.

description: The line is always long for Me So, so I assumed that the food was good. I waited in line for about 20 minutes, mind you I was the third person in line. I swept it off as them being busy and didn't really care. I only ordered sweet potato fries and a diet coke. They forgot about my order after waiting another 20 minutes. I finally got my fries after pestering the cook. They were burnt and listless. I will NEVER go back after that experience. 40 minutes for burnt fries is not worth the money I paid.
author: Krysten W.

description: My family and I had got food from here again in San Lorenzo and everytime we got the monster burger and both Cali and Flying Hawaiian with sweet potato fries there all Cooked well with perfection. If I see this truck again I will come back . It's a must to order the monster burger again. Thank you me so hungry .
author: Andrew M.

description:
Just had the Me So Hungry food truck at work. Couldn't help but saying the name like a vietnamese whore but i think it's part of the fun, no? 
The chicken slider was delicious and the shoe string fries with garlic were amazing! Not too intense on the garlic and the fry was perfect. 
They took a little long with the fries but we bombarded them!
Thanks!
author: Chanté B.

description:
Ok, so we did hit an evening that they had a bit of a rush and they handled it perfectly.

Food =
Cali Sliders ~ w/ Angus Beef, Smoked Apple-Wood Bacon, Balsamic Sauteed Onions, Gorgonzola Cheese Sauce = MY opinion = VERY tasty just could have used MORE of the cheese sauce !!! ( so make sure you ask for more before walking away from the truck ) 
Flyin' Hawaiian Slider ~ w/ Chicken, Crispy Maui Onions and Chipotle Aioli = My opinion = Very tasty, juicy, NOTHING bad to say !
Also had the onion rings = they are crunchy and seem overcooked, but the onion inside is still thick and juicy. BBQ sauce it's served with is nice.

Thumbs Up, would Def try again...........
author: Nicole B.

description:
I was mooching off of Laura L.'s Slider Sample and sweet potato fries....wow! I was socked by the flavors *and a bit of jealousy since I also craved her food as well as mine!*

The sample included the flyin' hawaiian, the cali, and the KTM.  The Flyin' Hawaiian w/ Chicken, Crispy Maui Onions and Chipotle Aioli was by far our favorite of the 3. It had the sweet and savory down pat and the sock of yummy flavors was just so good, I was this close to knocking out my cousin just so I can eat all her food. Our second favorite is the KTM, w/ Marinated Short Ribs, Pepper Jack Cheese, Crispy Onions and Spicy Crème Fraîche. There was that kicky hit with the pepper jack and creme fraiche...but it was also messy so be prepared! Third was the KTM, w/ Angus beef, Smoked Apple-Wood Bacon, Balsamic Sauteed Onions, Gorgonzola Cheese Sauce..which if we haven't tried the others would have been just as yummy.

The sweet potato fries were also excellent. They were crunchy and seasoned. The spicy creme fraiche sauce was the perfect dipping condiment for this tubor snack.

If you ever see this food truck around your neighborhood, do yourself a favor and get in line, cause it's that good!!
author: Pauline L.

description:
Me So Hungry to the rescue !

 It was a super slow day at work today so my little girl age of 7 1/2 came along and for all you parents out there. We all know kids get hungry and get picky. It was a big bonus that the Me So Hungry truck happen to be out in the front of my work place so we gave it a go and WALLA !!! it was a hit. my little girl loves it soo much she wants to go to work with me every Friday just to have the sliders from Me So Hungry. A must try again next time for sure.. But next time it's all for me not unless my little boss in with me.. Thumbs up !!!
author: Paul G.

description: Heard great things about this place, had to try it.  Super disappointed :(.  Friday night, 6:30 pm and it's a 1 man show.  Ordered the monster burger medium well, it looked amazing.  Took a bite and it was medium rare.  I took it back and he gladly put it back on the grill.  When I got it back it was cooked the way I wanted it but it lost all of its goodness (bacon, tomato, sauce).  I hope it was a fluke night, I'll try it once more, when there's at least 2 people running it.
author: Aaron P.

description:
Me So Hungry is a graphically bold truck with great food photography. The big black truck (and their usually long lines) easily overshadows the presence of neighboring trucks.

I got the KTM Sliders: "w/ Marinated Short Ribs, Pepper Jack Cheese, Crispy Onions and Spicy Spicy Crème Fraîche". It sounds just as good as it's described. Even though each element in the KTM Sliders packs a big flavor punch, it was still pretty easy to note each one of them. It's just a little too bit on the sweet side.

Only get the KTM Sliders if you're really hungry. I could have only gone with only a single slider. I've had their sweet potato fries before and they're good as well.
author: Michael H.

description: Best sliders on the planet. Get the KTM! It's a personal face and don't forget the sweet potatoe fries with that amazing sauce!
author: Jhona M.

description:
Okay yelpers, this is a new food truck that seemed to appear out of nowhere! 

Where did it come from? Good question.
A bit of bg on this truck. A guy named Johnny tried food from the original MeSoHungry based in LA. He loves it so much he decided to bring it to NorCal.

I looked at their menu and I couldn't decide, out of 3 sliders, what to get. So I got the sample which has all 3 of em. There is the Cali slider, Hawaiian, & and Angus rib one. All 3 of them have fantastic tastes that will make you come back for sure. Check back for more tips on the other menu items they have! I can't wait to try out their fries!

Tell Johnny and Rob I sent you guys.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Wow, I gotta say, i've never expected such good quality from a food truck. But Me-so-hungry hit the spot with their absolutely delectable and amazingly delicious and flavorful sampler platter. I ended up ordering The Cali, KTM, and the Hawaiian with an order of the parmesan fries. the tenderness and flavor of all the meats were absolutely enticing. Johnny, Rob, and the rest of the crew did an amazing job and prep time literally took less than 2 minutes for my order. Fast food speed, gourmet restaurant quality. I wish I could give you guys 10 stars!! Thank you for the great food, service, and upbeat attitude! Peace out.

PS: I look forward to your instagram account and many future visits.
author: Leyth E.

description:
I had a great first taste of Me So Hungry. They served up some of the tastiest food truck eats I've had yet (20 trucks and counting!). 

I ordered a trio of the Cali/short rib/Hawaiian sliders and enjoyed all three of them. The Hawaiian slider caught me off guard (in the best way possible) by the sweet intensity of the chicken & sauce coupled with the tangy-ness of the crispy onion strips. 

Next up, the Cali slider brought some balsamic-sauteed onions into the mix to create a fresh flavor profile. Since I don't do gorganzola, I swapped that out for the Asian bbq sauce, which made for a great switcheroo. My only gripe with the Cali was the burger meat was a little on the well side (**but I hadn't requested my preference; I'd recommend going medium rare though). 

Last up was the short rib slider and, hot damn, I haven't had short rib meat that tender in my life. The sweet Asian bbq sauce went perfectly with it. All in all, $11 is steep for sliders off a truck but, given that their ingredients are legit (grass fed beef ftw), and that each slider is crafted on a spongy, but fresh brioche-like bun, it's at least worth a try, but I warn you...you could get hooked.

I also ordered some garlic/parm fries. I liked the seasoning but wasn't crazy for the spuds themselves; overall it was good, but the fries were a little tough for that cut (they're not quite the crispy shoe string fries, more like a thin cut). If you go with someone, I recommend getting 2 or 3 sliders each and then splitting fries or onion rings. 

Kudos to them for coming out to Geng Rd, and kudos to them for their awesome, speedy service.
author: Nick P.

description:
Yummy burgers, we order the KTM Sliders which were two small (slider sized) burgers with marinated short ribs, paperback cheese, crispy onions and spicy creme fraiche on a super soft roll. The ribs were yummy, nice flavor, perfectly cooked and a nice texture that while tender did have a little tooth feel so it was rather nice. They are nicely presented on a high sided rectangular paper plate which is almost a rectangular bowl. I like his because it holds the burgers in place and captures any escaping ingredients. I also like the thrive cat toothpick that hold the rather soft burger together while I eat it (I ate arid the toothpick to the very end and everything stayed together). On the downside, the burgers only had a think slice of pepper jack that when tasted alone did not have any significant flavor, only a very faint pepperiness. The pepper jack I get att he local supermarket has more flavor and pepperiness than this one did. If there was any creme fraiche in our sliders, we could not taste them nor after taking the slider apart could we find any trace of it. The line had built up so I really did not want to wait all that time to complain then it again for that many sliders to be made for us again. They actually tasted good (the ribs were very good) and just needed a bit more to form a complete flavor experience.

The staff is good, professional and took the order accurately and quickly. I can't believe that they are still dangling a tablet out he window for people to do a credit card transaction, I hope they ordered the brand new ApplePay reader for Square so we can just wave our iPhone in front of the window and not have to deal with a dangling tablet (I really don't like to touch something the everyone else has touched, moment before eating gourmet sliders.

The price was high for how much for you got, its proved like a gourmet meal and they have gourmet ingredients but I did not find it to be a gourmet flavor profile and the excessively soft bread does not offer a gourmet texture.

I would try them again the next time they come around. I think they can easily do better and have the possibility to be a five star truck with some focus and effort on their part.
author: Bob L.

description: After a very long day at a horrible clinic with a friend, she suggested we take our minds off it and have some delicious grub...who am I to say no?! lol So we hit the food trucks and I found this gem awaiting my order. Stepped up and was sure of my choice (Hawaiian sliders & sweet potato fries plain), my friend wasn't but opted for the beef and loaded fries. I liked the service right off the bat so I handed the staff $25 as it was $24 (a bit pricey for a food truck, but it was my 1st experience so I was willing) and was happily awaiting my grub. My friend got the change and it was $16 instead of $1 so I had her promptly return the $ which the staff seemed very happy about (they thought I gave them two $20's) and 5min later order was ready and I was in Maui onion & chicken heaven lol. Really tasty and just right with the creme fresh and potatoes were overflowing but tasty! All in all I have to say I was impressed. I mean the beef was okay but my sliders were amazing. I highly recommend them and will be going back someday soon.
author: Bella B.

description:
I tried the Cali sliders and they were pretty good, but I love their sweet potato fries! They put cheese and garlic on them so you get this sweet, salty, garlicky taste. SO GOOD! My friend ordered the Hawaiian sliders and that was pretty good too. I'd have to say that I preferred the Hawaiian the better than the Cali ones, but only slightly. 

If you're not in the mood for sliders, definitely go for the fries and use the check-in offer to get free garlic fries. I forgot to use the offer but I got the sweet potato fries which I don't regret!
author: Lauren Y.

description:
Went to the SOMA StrEat Food lot today. 

They weren't open and ready for a while after the 11 am posted time on the web site.  I'm a total impatient NYer, but still.  And then 1 or 3 slider offerings were as the owner put it...."Still marinating and it's gonna be a while".  

I ordered the slider sample and wound up with an extra burger.  They consisted of an Asian sauced burger with cheese, the Flyin' Hawaiian Slider (Chicken, Crispy Maui Onions and Chipotle Aioli) and the Cali  (Angus beef, Smoked Apple-Wood Bacon, Balsamic Sauteed Onions, Gorgonzola Cheese Sauce).  All were decent and tasted like the ingredients were sourced from better suppliers, but for me they just didn't work at all.  The gorgonzola cheese sauce on the Cali tasted nothing more than mayo.  The bright spot was the chicken slider.  The pulled chicken was a good portion with only a few onions.  The Asian sauced burger was just ok.  

Maybe, I need to try the Kalbi slider and some fries and they'll be redeemed.  Get it together, you got a decent product!
author: Caesar R.

description: Couldn't wait out the hipster jackass attitude to order. Stood patiently without any acknowledgement, then curly brown hair exits the truck and walks right by me twice and can't bother to say hi or "gimme a sec". Took my money elsewhere.
author: Shal J.

description: Yes, such a delish food truck.  Worth the money because of taste and their huge portions.  I had their vegetarian sliders and some sweet potato fries.  MMMMMMmyummmy!
author: Michelle M.

description: Waited 45 minutes for a burger.  Wasted a lunch break. Hire another cook or something.
author: Brian K.

description: I had some sliders from here at oysterfest earlier this month. The presentation was good. We had a mixture of burgers and some garlic, cheese sweet potato fried. The food was satisfying for a truck food standard. It was $20 for the sliders & fries which was an ok price for truck food at a festival. These guys know what they are doing from a service point of view. It was like a production line. There was a bit of a wait but at least the burgers tasted fresh!
author: Kelly M.

description:
I decided to try the Cali sliders that most reviewers raved about (2 for $8). It's an angus beef slider with balsamic seasoned onions, arugala, bacon, and a creamy Gorgonzola. 
Well, medium rare was closer to medium, the first one I couldn't taste the onions and I'm not sure they even put any cheese on it . The second one obviously had cheese (because it was oozing out) but I still could barely taste the onion. The arugala was fresh on both, the bacon (obviously had been sitting out) was chewy on both, and I don't think they were worth $8. However, the slider certainly did have potential and I would be willing to try them again.
author: Erin L.

description: Showed up an hour late to a charity event at an elementary school yesterday and then took two hours for hungry kids and parents (who had run a 5k) to be served.
author: Team C.

description:
Cali Sliders!  Angus beef, smoked apple-wood bacon (Hello!), balsamic sauteed onions, Gorgonzola cheese sauce.  

As George Takei would say, "Oh my..."  

Yeah.  Pretty tasty stuff there.  They're not big.  They're sliders.  Of course, at $8 for two small slides, it's not cheap either.  One each for hubby and me to enjoy and still have room to try things from other places.
author: Denise M.

description: Just came out of the mall on blackfriday, all the thai place were close, saw this truck with a big ass line parking outside of urban,  their cali slider was super, if i still have stomach i would try everything on their menu
author: Khue M.

description:
Was pretty excited to try out this truck, despite the name/branding, the menu seemed promising.  Lets break it down.

Pros 
-Very friendly competent staff 
-Fresh made food
-Quality ingredients
-Menu is sensible, they listen to the customers and will change things as requested if possible
-Shoe string fries were good.  The garlic/parm is a complaint here a lot in yelp, the problem is it drops to the bottom of the plate so it seems like you don't get much of it, but you do, it's just not on the fries, instead it sits on the plate.

Cons
-Pricing is a big high.  I'm usually OK with food trucks pricing ~$15 for a lunch sized portion, but this pricing is more restaurant sit down $4 fries etc..

-Burger was way over cooked.  I was asked how I wanted it cooked and said medium.  It came back well-done, maybe over-done.  It was a slider size so I know those are hard to keep track of, but if you ask me how I want it cooked, and then ignore the fact that it's not even close...

-Chicken also seemed over cooked.  A bit tough/chewy for pulled chicken

-Brioche buns.  Seems like every truck is doing brioche buns now.  They look great in photos, but more often then not they are tough, somewhat stale, flavorless and way too bulky.

-Sweet potato fries were way overcooked.  They looked way dark, and tasted burnt.

This truck is run out of L.A. so it could vary by location, but the one here in S.F. overall I'd just say it was ok.  Good dudes on the truck, but the food was disappointing.
author: Nellie N.

description: I had the California sliders. They were pretty good, but I feel like they were lacking something. Service was friendly, but kinda slow considering it wasn't that busy. They had a Monday special on some burgers, so I think I'll give that a try next time I see the food truck around ;)
author: Bianca C.

description:
Just had the Flyin' Hawaiian Sliders and they were hummmm delish!!!!

Me so Happy :-)
author: Nneka G.

description:
I had to update my review because people at work are still talking about this.

So as I mentioned before, I'm super picky about burgers because they are always so dry! I hate it. But, Me So Hungry made me eat my words, and these words were outstanding so I'm totally fine with that.

We booked them for a lunch party at work .First off, these guys were super easy to work with and they went all out and even gave us a holiday surprise.(Maple Glazed Donuts)

We ordered the Cali Sliders, OMG! Yes, addicting! Loved how juicy the meat was along with the bacon, onion and cheese, heavenly.
I also had the sweet potato fries with garlic and parm. Really, really good.The spicy sauce rocked, I want to put it on everything.(like my body, rawrr)
