And, as for our surprise donuts,they were scrumptious! The glaze on top was actually made with bacon crumble and powder sugar. Seriously, the highlight of the party.
Good job! Everyone LOVED the food and we will certainly return soon.
author: Tiana G.

description:
The Cali Slider, good, but not great. 

Food Tried - Cali Sliders (w/ Angus, Smoked Apple-Wood Bacon, Balsamic Sauteed Onions, Gorgonzola Cheese Sauce)

Price Paid - $8.00

The Cali Sliders looked flavorful on the menu, so I decided to give them a shot. The food came out sizzling, so I knew it was freshly cooked and not microwaved. The Angus beef had some nice grill marks as well. 

But, I have to say I was a little disappointed by the Cali Sliders. The Gorgonzola Cheese sauce, although not smothered on, overpowered the overall  the sliders, especially the bacon and beer, which usually overpowers food in general when mixed. The bacon was hidden under the beef and onions that I rarely got a taste of it. The Angus Beef was cooked just right, but its flavor was hidden under the sauces overpowering flavor. 

Overall, the Cali Sliders were good, but the sauce overpowered any other flavors that might have been in the slider. I would recommend the slider if you're a huge Gorgonzola fan, but if you're not, then choose something else, like the Duke.
author: Marco M.

description: Had some sliders at the Noriega Street Fair - I had the Flyin' Hawaiian Sliders and JJ had the KTM sliders. Of course, we swapped one each and I preferred mine and he preferred his but both were DELICIOUS! Okay, so the price point is a little high, but food trucks these days don't seem that cheap in general.
author: Mi M.

description: Total rip off. Didn't even get fries with my sliders after spending $16.50!!!! Just a water.  And ONLY ONE of the three siders I picked was good (cali slider).  Not worth it
author: Brandon N.

description: So good. Their prices are incredibly reasonable too. Whatever you do, make sure you save room for a maple doughnut. It will be the best decision you've ever made in your entire life. Just make sure you're near a bed when your done for when the instant and yet oh so satisfying food coma sets in.
author: Erica E.

description:
"Winner Winner Chicken Dinner!" This was a great decision to have them cater my daughter's birthday party. The convenience of having a kitchen handle the food and no clean up was awesome. They were fast and competent with the best tasting burgers. Sometimes they can get super busy and that's a drag but anything good is going to have a line.

This is a must food truck.
author: Eric A.

description:
Had the Cali and KTM sliders with a side of sweet potato fries. The food was the bomb. KTM sliders were my fave because I personally love anything short ribs. 

Aside from the food the service is top notch. Very friendly and personable. When you so hungry you better go to me so hungry.
author: victoria p.

description:
Recently I ate here at the food truck in SF! I ordered the Flin' Hawaiian Sliders and Sweet potatoe fries!

Breakdown Review:

Slider - Very yummy! They were great although they were a little cold (which may have been caused by the sauce). 

Fries - HEAVEN! They sauce they serve w. them is nearly life changing! I used to HATE sweet potatoe fries until after trying theirs!


the wait wasnt long at all & the workers were sooooo sweet!

OVERALL:
 
This meal is a must have and i'd DEFINITELY eat there again =)
author: Nelly C.

description:
Was at SOMA the other day and was VERRY HUNGRY! I hit up the truck since it had the longest line to see what it was all about. The workers were GREAT. I love when I can joke around and have a good conversation when ordering my food.

Didn't take to loong, and it was DELICIOUS! I had the CALI SLIDER and Garlic Parmesan Fries and they were absolutely to die for.. It came with a really good sauce that I can't remember the name of. I totally suggest you guys to check this food truck out. It even has a cute pink monster on the truck! LOVE!
author: James A.

description:
Had some of their sliders at a charity event the other month.  Absolutely delicious!  I had the Cali Slider and I literally could have eaten 6 of them to myself.  The Gorgonzola cheese is an AMAZING compliment to the salty bacon, balsamic grilled onions, and bright greens.  Staff was super friendly, even with the crazy line, and the fries were wonderful!

Thought I had the same sliders from the same company just today, but it was a DIFFERENT 'Me So Hungry' food truck.  Apparently there is a Me So Hungry and Me So Hungry Too.  The Me So Hungry Too that I had today definitely didn't compare; burger wasn't seasoned enough and just lacked over all flavor.  Next time the actual ME SO HUNGRY is around, I'll definitely be going to that one over the other.
author: Alexess N.

description: Hands down one of the best slider trucks ive ever ate at not only the sliders but the garlic parmesan sweet potato fries with a side of creme fraiche was the best crucky fries i ever had. If anyone eats at this truck you would say the same thing . The sliders that are the ones ive  got were the Cali , Flyin'Hawaiin , and the Ktm ! Make sure to get those sliders they are the best around town! I'll be coming back to this truck again forsure. MeSoSatisfied!!!!
author: James H.

description:
I went over to SoMa StEatFood for lunch on a gorgeous sunny afternoon and found myself drawn to Me So Hungry.  The sliders looked great but what really caught my eye on the menu was the Monster Burger.

I went up to order and had some banter with the guy working the truck.  I had mentioned I didn't want pickles on the burger and so he turned back to the cook and said "extra pickles" as a joke but then told me they don't even have pickles on the truck at all.  I half-laughed it off.  I get it, trying to make a joke. Ha.

Well, that was all forgiven when I bit into the burger and had a mouthful of the garlic sweet potato fries.  Both were delicious!  I'd definitely give this truck a shot again the next time I see it among food trucks and I have a craving for a burger.
author: James G.

description:
Got the sampler sliders here. The burgers tasted nice and meaty. The Hawaiian is very messy though, so make sure you got napkins. All in all, pretty good burgers. Next time i gotta try their real burgers.

Also, 5 stars for giving me a free meal for giving you 5 stars!
author: Andrew H.

description: Their advertised hours of operation are COMPLETELY WRONG . We drove all the way across the city and got to the truck over twenty minutes before their stated closing time and they said they were closed. With tons of people still eating and cooks still cooking. A business that states hours should be true to what they're staying. Bad customer service not only in the false advertising but the man behind the net was so rude when he said they closed already. Your website said ten pm and we got there at 930!
author: Emma F.

description: The price point is WAAAAAYYYYYYY to high! I paid $14 for tator tots and 2 sliders. That's a lot. That being said it was really good but for the price it should knock me on my ass wanting more...that's not happening.
author: Jill T.

description: I had the hawaiian chicken slider.  It was good but a bit sweet for me and I'm not the biggest fan of shredded chicken either.  The parmesan fries were awesome and heard the short rib sliders were delicious too.  Good people on this truck as they were kind enough to do me a favor for another food truck.  Go support these guys and you won't be disappointed!
author: Ricky C.

description:
I had received an email from the owner as a response from my original review. Customer service is key, and I really appreciate the effort put forth by the owner to improve his business. Despite my meh first experience with me so hungry, his prompt response and openness to reviews make me look forward to going to me so hungry again. Thank you, johnny c! Hope the second time around will live up to expectations! Here's to 2014!

Here's the email that I had received. I had omitted some parts for privacy.

Hi Randell,
Johnny C. has sent you a message on Yelp:
Your Review 
"Hey Randell,

I'm very sorry to hear that your experience at the Me So Hungry truck with us wasn't to your satisfaction. We take great pride in making sure every order we do pleases our very important customers.  After all, we do what we do out of love for making great food and providing you with the best possible experience.  I actually am having a meeting with my staff this week to discuss this specific review ~ and to make sure it doesn't happen again.   We are making changes daily.... To ensure our food comes out much quicker we have made some changes to our staffing as well as how we take orders, prepare them and serve.  We are also updating our menu for 2014 to remove certain items that may hold us up during busy times.  We also are adding timing system for each ticket so we can monitor ticket times to ensure orders are processed quicker.  Since we dont do any pre-cooking and prepare each meal fresh, it can be difficult to deal with a bunch of orders at the same time.  However, we feel we are making some major changes for the better.

in any case, I really would like to offer you another chance to try our food and hopefully provide you with a much better experience the 2nd time around. if you have any additional comments or suggestions I would be totally happy to hear your input.  

feel free to contact me directly if you would like to setup another time to come by and try our food and see the changes we made or if you want to provide some additional input here is my info.  (Info omitted for privacy)

Sincerely,

Johnny C.
Owner"
author: Randell J.

description: Very tasty burger (about $12).  I don't remember the exact name--maybe the Monster burger? It was raining, so not many people in line (glad they had an awning/tent to keep me dry). The food came quickly, but clearly they are cooked to order so it took about 10 minutes--maybe a bit less. No complaints from me. I'd rather wait for something fresh and hot than have it prepared ahead of time.   It was cooked perfectly for my taste--I ordered it medium and it came pink-to-light red and juicy.  Just the way I like it.  Next time, I might switch out the bacon for the crispy onions. The Asian BBQ sauce was a little on the sweeter side.  My only surprise was that an order of fries (either shoestring or sweet) were $5. Seems a bit steep for a side dish, so I skipped them. Also, they didn't have their bacon brioche donuts--I was going to take them home for dessert after dinner, so I was bummed about that.
author: Greg R.

description: We had Me So Hungry for a private event and they called two hours before to let us know the fryer had broke so fries would not be served.  They added one slider and stated they would reduce the cost by $100.  This was over two months ago and we have yet to receive a refund.  I have emailed numerous times and not received a response.  Such poor business ethic.  The night of the event they were also extremely slow.  I had such high hopes and this was such a let down.  I would not recommend Me So Hungry for a private event.  Extremely disappointed in their professionalism.
author: Erin P.

description: Saw the food truck outside of Drake's Brewing Co and decided to give them a try. The Cali slider was pretty good. But the KTM slider was amazing!
author: Jessica W.

description: Just tried them at Hardly Strictly Bluegrass. Waited over 45 minutes for 4 sliders. Sliders were decent, but definitely not worth the wait. They need to at least warn people who are expecting to wait no more than 15 minutes that it's going to be a while. We didn't even get the fries which they did warn would take 10-15 minutes extra...and they ran out anyway while we were there(midday  at a festival). Need to improve on preparation for events like this or at least know their limits.
author: Alexandra T.

description: The slider left much to be desired for.. meat was juicy and soft but it did not taste like anything but hoisin sauce... I could make bbq and dipped it in hoisin sauce at home...
author: Kim P.

description: On my lunch break and decided to try this spot since it was the truck with the longest line. You know what they say if its long line, food must be good. They took my order pretty fast. I ordered KTM sliders and asked for it to go. Hoping to get it fast. But the food took a while to get. Once I got back to work, I took a look at my sliders & it was missing the crispy onions! Paid $9+ for two sliders, long wait & it had missing ingredients! This place didn't fulfill my hungryness.
author: Pauline I.

description: Fast, friendly, and delicious. One star off for charging $3 for a bottle of water. The Cali sliders were a little bigger than I expected and my kid and I were able to split the order.
author: Liz O.

description: I waffled between 3 and 4 stars. I got the sampler of the chicken, Angus, and short rib sliders. The Angus was awesome! It had grilled or caramelized onions, the patty was savory and flavorful. The chicken was dry, it could've used some extra Aoli. I thought it was odd the chicken sandwiches were 'hawaiian' but had a chipotle sauce. My short rib slider only had one and a half pieces of meat on it.. it knocked my socks off, but I felt jipped on the meat. The buns were MONEY. The fries were oily and a little undercooked for my liking, but i like my fries crispy. My expectations weren't quite met, but I would eat there again.
author: Jason A.

description:
After finally ordering, it took forever to get my burgers then I was told that my sweet potato fries weren't ready and would be a few more minutes.  It took another ten minutes before I had fries.

When I looked at my burgers, the buns were about 1/3 burnt (black) so I decided to walk back to the office, reheat my burgers which were no longer warm, and do some surgery on the buns.

The burger itself was tasty and well-seasoned, but this wasn't a good use of my money or my time.
author: Daniel Q.

description: Came from Hawaii! This place is legit! Gatlic parmesan sweet potato fries is killa! We are in club Novela and they  delivered it inside!!! Must see
author: Nicholas S.

description: This place made me so nauseous.  I got some free oily ass fries with my yelp check in.  Everyone is doing asian flavors these days.  Sweet and sour seems to be the most popular asian thing to do.  Sweet and sour is not even asian its fucking panda express.  The burgers were sweet and dripping with sweet sauce.  barf
author: Fatty A.

description: Super slow and really gross. I ordered "The Duke" and the gal who helped me was a sweetheart but I waited for about 20 minutes, harshing my Sangria buzz and pulling me away from the party I was attending for too long. When I got my order the cheese bread was burnt beyond all recognition and the whole thing was really dry. I went back and asked if I could get some bread that wasn't burnt and the sweet gal insisted on remaking it for me. I was grateful at first but when I got back to my table the bread was perfect on the outside but burnt as hell on the inside AGAIN. I ended up throwing away the whole thing. Me STILL so hungry and it's their fault.  I will not be back. :(
author: Russ M.

description:
Slow service - need some MAJOR HELP with Ops.  From order to pick up was 23 mins!

Out of stock - ran out of short rib and angus beef sliders at lunch time; peeps waited in line for 10 mins or more and then saw them write on the menu that they ran out of major items

Where's the beef? - Angus beef slider was nearly all bun, little patty.  WTF?

Wanted to like this truck but no go.  Need some better planning, more generous portions.

Guys are cool (they offered a refund for drink or fries), but this was not a great experience.
author: Henry F.

description: Will never go back, stood at the counter which seemed like the longest 5min, and both workers just standing there talking to each while one female worker was texting and nobody taking my order. Once I got my good the short rib sliders and garlic Parmesan fries, the meat was dry and the fries were cold and bland, no garlic no parmesan. This was at the Belmont off the grid.  I will never go back and will not recommend.
author: Michael M.

description: YUM!!! ordered the KTM Sliders and Onion Rings..I was not disappointed I was told by the cool dude who took my order that I ordered the two best items on the menu..if that is the case I will be back.  The sliders had a perfect amount of short rib meat and not too saucey,  the onion rings nice and crispy...and even stayed crispy for the walk back to my office a couple blocks away..the line was long but moved quick..
author: Kristine D.

description: Nothing really special about these sliders at all.  The staff needs to learn about proper seasoning and keeping food hot.  The wait time for my food was way too long and it was cold. The Garlic fries were way too greasy and not salted properly.  The Short rib slider tasted like a flank steak sandwich! Not worth the money and time.
author: Thomas H.

description: This was a good burger and fries. We got the monster burger and regular fries but it was $20. I would have been happier paying $13 or $14 for the pair. Staff were very friendly. They were parked at the bernal heights fiesta on the hill.
author: Jo M.

description: Last time we got the sliders.  We ordered them "medium rare" and they were served "very well done."  This time, we told them four times:  "We want the sliders rare."  They were served "very well done."  We won't be getting those again.  Clearly they don't know how to do anything but over-cook the sliders.  Too bad.  The garlic fries are inedible, absolutely AWFUL.  The onion rings are indescribably delicious, hence the two stars.  They are crunchy on the outside and full of flavor.  This food truck could (AND SHOULD) be so much better.
author: Thomas M.

description:
I went to SoMa StrEat Food Park for lunch during a weekday and decided to try this place out since I haven't tried it yet and I would miss them from time to time when they did show up. The line was pretty long that day but I was set on trying them.

I got the Monster Burger and it took some time for them to make my food. It probably wasn't longer than what it normally would have taken (~7 minutes) but since I was in a bit of a hurry due to the line, it felt longer than it really was (strange how that works). The burger was cooked just the way I requested and plenty flavorful. The only problem I sort of I had with this burger is that the sauce was a bit sweeter than what I would have liked but not terrible by any means.

Over all, could definitely see myself coming back if the opportunity arises. Service was fast and friendly.
author: Richard C.

description:
I waited in line for over 30 minutes. Line was not around the block, it was just 7-8 people in front of me. After 30 minutes, there were still 4 people in front of me. Went to the next truck over which had a *longer* line and got my food before the person that had been in front of me at Me So Hungry had even ordered. 

We're talking burgers and fries here. No excuse for being so slow, need to work on organization or staffing or something. 

Oh, and they were out of 2 of the 3 types of sliders, and their fryer was broken so no fries - which makes it even more mind-boggling that they could be so slow.
author: Chad T.

description: This place rocks!!! Dude was so cool and even convinced me on ordering an extra combination fries...glad I did because my party ate everything love it! Sliders were great! Excellent choice for easter! :-)
author: Mercedes A.

description: My family and I ate here for the first time yesterday. We ordered the Cali sliders as well as the Flyin' Hawaiian sliders. I have to say that we came 30 minutes to closing. I was worried that we would get last pick of things and be disappointed with our food. We were NOT disappointed! The meat was juicy, and overall the sliders were delicious, with the right mix of flavors. I look forward to eating here again.
author: Janice L.

description: Had Me So Hungry for the first time at Soma Streat Food. They hawaiian sliders were exciting and satisfying. The Sweet Potato fries were maybe a little too crispy but seasoned well. I would go back and try some other sliders.
author: Halley B.

description: The angus beef / bacon / gorgonzola sliders, with balsamic onions, made me had a full blow food gasm in front of Mighty. Perfect texture, seamless flavor, in a word: redonk!
author: Alex S.

description:
Chicken sliders - BOMB
Hamburger slider - Really good
Fries - Pretty good, as well
Price - $12 for 2 sliders plus fries is a bit much, but the quality is definitely there.

Must say, that chicken slider is incredible.  I am all over those things again when I go back.

Borderline 4/5 star because of the price, but overall I think the sliders are too good to hold it down.
author: Max B.

description: Organic, veggie fed meat, and locally sourced! By far one of the best food trucks around! Their chicken slider is my favorite. Packed with so much flavor I wanted to lick the plate when I was done.
author: Stephen B.

description: Cali sliders and garlic fries were awesome. Will go back for sure.
author: Craig I.

description: The long line was more than worth it, I had the sliders& the maple donuts! Both were delicious. I usually do not like to wait in any lines,but I would wait again for this.
author: Kelly A.

description: Omg, today was my first time to try their Cali slider!  And yes it was #screaming #bombdotcom.  After this experience I don't think I may want to try any other Slider or burger.  The bun was so fresh and buttery.  The angus beef patty was so juicy.  The bacon was so lean and perfectly cooked.  Every thing about that slider has the most satisfying flavor.  It was so delicious i forgot to take a picture.  Johnny JT and I will be back to the point we will be regulars
author: MaryJane D.

description: I tied this food trucks chicken base slider and was disappointed, not much flavor to offer, in the other hand their garlic fries were great. Not sure if I want to try out their other sliders.
author: Rasec A.

description: Ok so waited for 20 min for my slider sampler and sweet potato fries. They call my name to pick up the food and this dude jumps to the window and makes off with my order because they did not ask for the ticket with my order number on it. Dude even took my freaking fries man.... bold. thats all I got to say. So im pissed at this point and not about to wait for another 20 min, luckily they stepped up and replaced the food immediately, (probably had to make somebody else wait longer) and even kicked in a coke for the screw up. All without having to ask.... well played my friend. Well played. Saved the day for your review. BTW the food is super tasty and I will be back.
author: Brandon L.

description:
Stopped by SOMa Streat park: pleaseny surprised.
Tried the sampler and it was amazing,my fav was the Cali sliders with smoked applewood bacon and gorgonzola sauce was perfect with the yummy angus beef. Crispy onions with short ribs was spot on with the KTM slidets. Topped it all off with seasoned sweet potatoe fries dipped in homemade Creme fraiche-yum!
Wait time was reasonable, less then 10inutes to get a big order out.
Definitely worth checking out.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
the duke burger is large enough to feed 3 north korean families. quite possibly, the best bang for the buck food truck item in history.

the 5 stars, however, come from the flavor in the burger. i worship this sandwich. haven't tried anything else.
author: Peter P.

description: Went to novela and they don't serve food , however , this food truck was located outside.  Being super hungry, stepped outside the bar and tried to order food. Literally ,waited for over five minutes without any help and then the gentlemen turned around and told me food was not ready and come back in 20 mins. I was thinking why don't you take our order first and when the food is ready I'll pick it up. So 20 mins later or so, I ordered my food got Sliders. The pork had nothing special to it , just meat no garnish. The beef one was okay, meat was a little dry. I ordered sweet potatoes  fries, and what was so funny when it arrived at the table it being mixed with regular fries. I was dumbfounded and asked the gentlemen. He said sorry we ran out. You would think he would have the audacity to tell me without having to ask. I'll pass. No matter how busy you are , should never compromise the quality !!
author: Nhung T.

description: What I ate maple glazed  donuts OMG!!! The freaking best worth every dollar I've also tried the calis and flyin Hawaiian s great sliders I love the gorg sauce on the calis the meat has a nice light pink to it the chicken is well seasond love the combination of flavor in the sliders workers are really nice.... if you come to me so hungry try the donuts you will go crazy.. i will definitely be returning
author: Sal F.

description: Hands-down the best sweet potato fries. Smothered in garlic and served with a sauce (I am guessing it is a chipotle aioli of some kind) - they are SO tasty. I did not try anything else on the menu but am looking forward to going back soon.
author: Candice D.

description: Great gourmet sliders and friendly staff!  I loved the Kobe sliders and the garlic fries. All their sauces are delicious!
author: nathan k.

description: Angus beef burger with Gorgonzola cheese, bacon & grilled onions was PERFECT!!!! The chicken and short rib slider was good but too sweet in my opinion. The buns they use for all of the sliders are amazing!! Fries are fresh, real parmesan & garlic...just a cool place to eat! SOMA Streatfood is the place to go! And they have a Sangria truck with happy hour;))
author: Danielle W.

description: Terrible service. Waited over an hour and half. How long does it take to cook sliders or burgers? Very unprepared as clearly food was not prepped ahead of time. Showed up at 11:45am at San Bruno location and ran out of a lot of things by 12:10pm (sweet potato & onion rings). Clearly do not know what they are doing here.
author: Kendric O.

description: Best Slider Truck on the PLANET Hands Down!!!! and the Duke Burger on cheese Bread OMG! to die for
author: Paulette J.

description: Had one each of the three *giant* carnivore sliders plus garlic parmesan fries. Note to self: will get two next time, or else food coma. The burger was the best one, the gorgonzola and onions strong in that one (in a good way).
author: Maximillian M.

description: Bad customer service experience today. After waiting 10 min in line I was told that they ran out of veggie burgers. Not phased I then asked to just get some sweet potato fries when he informed me that there's an $8 minimum on using cards. I said "even though you ran out of my burger"? He said my least favorite human expression "it is what it is" and I took my card back. As I walked away he said "I was going to let it go but then you said it like that." Guys... It's easy to get a big head and forget your serving people. However, when you run out of an item (although it is to be expected) you should make sure that the person who stood in your line isn't then further inconvenienced by a bad attitude or a silly policy that you made for optimal purchasing moments. It isn't my fault you ran out of the item. It is your fault for not marking it as being out and then getting an attitude with someone who used to be a fan of your stinkin' burger. Skip this one guys. They forgot how to treat people.
author: Curtis M.

description: We tried the sliders sampler (comes with 3 different sliders) and an order of onion rings.  The rings are good.  The sliders were just ok.  The buns were not very fresh and the fillings were on the boring side.  The Cali-slider reminded me a bit of a school lumch hamburger from my youth in the early 80s.  Too bad, because good sliders are such a treat.
author: Amber B.

description: I was eager to try this food truck after reading about their Cali Sliders but became quickly disappointed once I bit into a cold piece of angus beef. I should have known not to have too high of an expectation once I saw the guy sprinkle some stuff (salt or garlic) over my sweet potato fries with no gloves on. He also handed me my food with all this stuff stuck to his hands. Nevertheless, I finished my food cause my mom taught me to never waste food or money. I would've given one star but I'm giving two stars because I did like the spicy creme fraiche.
author: GINGER Y.

description: Don't waste your time! It's been 30 min and we are still waiting for our food. They need to get their act together!
author: Bernard H.

description: I am picky when it comes to meat..but the Cali slider hit the spot. Cooked well done, it was still juicy and flavorful. For me, the portion size was adequate. The tanginess of the balsamic onions is what I enjoyed. Will try Flyin'Hawaiin Slider next time.
author: Alli C.

description: Tried it again today (4/4), and was rewarded with very slow service (food truck personnel friendly) but the beef on the Cali slider tasted as though it had come off a steam table -- overdone, somewhat oaty, no char taste and not much flavor. Flyin' Hawaiian with shredded chicken, creme fraiche,  and siracha sauce (with toasted onions) had some flavor but still not much else. Both sliders would be improved with more vegetables. Biroche bread was good, but on the whole not worth the high prices. They were out of KTM sliders. Given this truck a fair try, and not certain will return.
author: Matt R.

description: Angus burger was dry, the bread was stale. Ugh, burger King would have been tastier. Pass.
author: b t.

description: My wife and I came to Oakland's First Friday and we noticed the long line to MeSoHungry, so thought we'd see what the hype was all about. I chatted with the owner while we ordered and learned that they were on the verge of opening a fixed location and second truck. At this point, I felt secure about place. THEN we tried the food and it was not as expected. The Cali Slider beef was dry and so was the bun. Eh, I'll stick to Phil's in Berkeley.
author: Joseph M.

description:
How can one make the burgers wait 10 minutes on the counter and still get the fried barely warm ??

Garlic/parsley fries had no garlic and barely any parsley (a few bits of cheese were lost here and there, though...).

Overall it's grossly overpriced for quantities and taste. First disappointment of the food corner...
author: Yo D.

description: Food is kind of pricy, I ordered the Cali slider, with tax almost $10 for 2 small sliders. I was disappointed as I have high expectation for slider at that price.  Meat was dry and no taste, only tasted the onion in it.
author: Fion T.

description: My husband and I were just at the Me So Hungry truck. The menu looks good except when we ordered they didn't have the bread hamburger should be on. We just ask for any other role that hey had, and they said they would not do that,  so we ended up walking away and they lost about a $25 order. We will not try that truck again if they can't be accommodating. My husband and I joked that we know why they are so hungry.
author: michelle b.

description: KTM sliders were full of flavor with a hint of hot chilies.  Awesome just a bit pricey at $9 but well worth it.   Friendly service and quickly served.   I want to try the other items next time so I'll be back!
author: Dennis K.

description: I found this place by chance coming from Costco now wanting to wait in their food line and eat crap. So I wander into this foodtruck zone and go to the only burger and fries place. They don't have just the classic cheese burger it was hoping for, and not being picky I get a sampler and get two short rib sliders and a angus bacon slider with gorgonzola cheese with garlic Parmesan fries. When I go to pay the total was ridiculous, it was $23 something for three sliders and fries no drink. My food came quick and looked good so I was going to ignore the steep price if the food was delicious. Which it wasn't... The burger was super dry with no bacon to speak of and the cheese was in sauce form and not even real. As for my other two sliders they were better but not by much. The cheese in these was suppose to be pepper jack but it came as some type of pink paste (fake cheese again), but the pulled short rib was really good I'll hand them that. It was all meat not to much else. Now for the fries they were alright but needed a lot of salt. Overall I'm really disappointed and if it had cost me 10 bucks I wouldn't have cared so much, but it was almost 30 bucks for this. I could have gotten a crap load of McDonald's and been 10x happier.
author: Elayna M.

description: i tried the duke burger it was great! only took a few minutes to make and the staff was very friendly. its truly like a restaurant on wheels! i love that they have a variety of items to choose from each burger so different from the other. i think anybody can find something on this truck that will keep u coming back for more!!! i will definately be a regular customer!
author: Monique F.

description: Tried to order a hamburger they were out of the type of bun they like to put it on it so they refused to put it on any other type of bun. Rude and totally unprofessional I can understand why me so hungry.
author: Jeff G.

description: Trailer food is a tricky game of getting something good without spending too much. I had the fries here and two sliders, which was just enough. The fries were worth getting, the sliders were only slightly better. I would order the cal slider, but honestly I don't remember the other one I got.
author: Nik K.

description: I wasn't sure what I wanted to eat, so I wanted over to the Soma StrEAT Food Park for lunch.  I'm not sure why, but the Cali sliders called to me.  (Probably the balsamic sauteed onions, which do make the slider!)  My only wish is that I'd asked for one Cali and one KTM slider (marinated short ribs and creme fraiche).  I don't think I've enjoyed a burger that much in a long time.
author: Matthew G.

description: Love the KMT slider--so juicy and tender, tastes like a glorious pot roast sandwich. Can't go wrong with pepper jack, either.
author: Nicholas A.

description: Waited in line to order for over half an hour (figured it must be good if people were lined up and waiting).  Ordered the slider sampler, then waited at least another 15 minutes for my order to be ready.  Finally got my food and found a table and sat down to eat.  Bulgogi and chicken sliders were cold...COLD!  And what the hell possessed the crew to think that I wanted the veggie burger slider instead of the angus beef with bacon slider???  And it was a half a veggie burger, charred (burnt) super crispy thrown on a slider roll...LAME.  Why would I order a sampler of sliders, all with meat, but decide I want one with the veggie burger patty instead of the one with angus beef and bacon...BACON?  I mean, really?    And then how are you going to serve up cold burnt fare after making your customers wait nearly an hour in line?  Worst food truck experience I have ever had.  I will never return as a customer and will spread the word to all who will listen.  This truck is terrible.
author: Shepherd S.

description: I usually only write bad reviews because the fact that their service is so slow that I have time while I am waiting for them. A friend of mine that works in the area told me about me so hungry. A slider truck, and I thought yum. I have tried curry up now while they went to oracle, chairman bao when at the mint plaza. The line when I got their was about 10 in front, so I thought it must be good. Took about 10 minutes to order but that gave my husband time to check out their menu. We ordered the sampler, 2 shortribs, sweet potato fries, and onion rings. We had to drop of food for the friend that let us know about it. First off the sliders were great and the sweet potato fries were amazing. They give you a pretty good amount of fries and they are good compared to other sweet potato places I've tried. All in all I will go back to them again if they are in the same location on Tuesday because that is my day off. For the other people that said it took them 1and 1/2 hours to get their food, that's some b.s. I went on my day off, so knowing that they would be in front of some office, I went at 12 to make sure I was in the somewhat front of the lunch break line. I got my food in 15 minutes and was grubbing away in my friend's work parking lot at 1100 bay hill.
author: Lillian K.

description: I was in the restaurant business for 8 years and wow have food trucks made a big impact on the quality of food compared to your fast food chains. Me so hungry gets your burger fix on point. You can get a sampler that gives you a variety. Chicken, hamburger, and a shortrib. Your fast food chains don't offer this and a restaurant would charge a hefty dollar if offered as a combo. Will definitely be returning again and soon. Are you guys there every Tuesday?
author: Ant K.

description: Great food! Super tasty! Definitely one of my favs now :) Friendly service! Love the name! Try it out, its sooo good!
author: Hannah L.

description: I just ordered 6 dozen sliders for a pool party at our house and they were awesome!  The KTM (short rib) slider is my favorite!  But they are all really delicious.  We had the Cali sliders, the KTM, the Hawaiian chicken sliders, and the veggie patty sliders.  All our guests raved about the food.  Me So Hundry can customize their menu to fit your needs so they are a must try for your next shindig!
author: Joy B.

description: Ordered the Cali burgers, pretty good while I was eating them, but got sick two hours later:(  Our food did not come all together so half of us ate first, the other half ate 20 minutes later. (only a party of 4). The food was over priced for sliders, especially when the cooks are handling the food with their bare hands-gross! Also, could you please wear some hair nets. I take more food safety precautions when I volunteer at the food pantry. I would never eat here again.
author: Dianna G.

description: seriously, beats out any other slider truck in the city, gourmet service.. FROM A TRUCK!! the folks on board are friendly, helpful, have a sense of humor, and get the food out super quick and with a deliciousness. juicy burgers, garlic parmesan fries and the maple glazed donuts really hit the spot. its my normal sunday go to at soma street food park, sangria and sliders.. couldn't get any better on a sunday funday!
author: Bob M.

description: 2 things...frozen sweet potato fries that take 30 minutes to get. Not worth the wait for burger and fries.
author: John H.

description: Pretty decent, I would recommend the KTM or hawaiian sliders over the cali sliders (the beef was sooo dry).  Overall, good but not *great*.
author: Cathy L.

description: This was the first food truck i have ever tried and I must say the food is amazing!  Even better than some restaurants!  I bought the "Sliders Sample", I liked all three sliders although the Cali slider was my favorite.  Whenever they are in town again, I am definitely gonna go for another.
author: Sean C.

description: omg....."been there done that" does NOT apply to this place...sliders were big enough..but had to order the "Duke".....gimme a break...i have no way of describing how incredible it is...still trying to figure out what they did to the bread...stop reading..just GO order...worth every penny.
author: Lela M.

description: I thought the chicken slider tasted good, but I had to wait for over an hour and a half for lunch. Not happy about that at all!
author: Stephanie L.
